articles.author: Maya Gebeily, James Mackenzie, John Irish
articles.description: The Paris conference aims to mobilise both humanitarian aid and support for the Lebanese military.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills Lebanese troops as France rallies support for army

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Current climate policies will result in global warming of more than 3 degrees Celsius (5.4 degrees Fahrenheit) by the end of the century, according to a United Nations report on Thursday, more than twice the rise agreed to nearly a decade ago.
articles.title: Climate set to warm by 3.1 C without greater action, UN report warns

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Andrew Mills
articles.description: U.S. and Israeli negotiators will gather in Doha in the coming days to try to restart talks toward a deal for a ceasefire and the release of hostages in Gaza, officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: US, Israeli negotiators to discuss Gaza ceasefire deal in Doha

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Canada went too far in its response to a labor shortage following the pandemic, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Thursday as his government unveiled a plan to slash the number of immigrants to ease pressure on housing and social services.
articles.title: Canada to cut immigration to ease housing, social services strain

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva warned on Thursday that the world is in danger of becoming mired in a low-growth, high-debt path that will leave governments with fewer resources to improve opportunities for their people and tackle climate change and other challenges.
articles.title: IMF chief says world economy at risk of low-growth malaise, rising dissatisfaction

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austria's lower house of parliament on Thursday elected its first ever far-right speaker after his Freedom Party won last month's parliamentary election and many conservatives backed him over the objections of the left and the Jewish community.
articles.title: Austrian parliament elects first far-right speaker over left's objections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 10,000 people in Haiti have been internally displaced in the last week as armed gangs operating in and around the capital Port-au-Prince ramp up attacks on areas they do not yet control, according U.N. migration agency estimates on Thursday.
articles.title: More than 10,000 Haitians flee gang attacks in past week, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin on Thursday did not deny U.S. claims that North Korea had sent troops to Russia but said that it was up to Moscow how to run its mutual defence clause with Pyongyang and accused the West of escalating the Ukraine war.
articles.title: Putin does not deny reports about North Korea troops

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said it had hit a Hamas command and control centre.
articles.title: At least 17 Palestinians killed in Israeli strike on school in central Gaza, hospital says

articles.author: Mark John, Libby George
articles.description: As U.S. election jitters hung over this week's meeting of global finance chiefs in Washington, a smiling Vladimir Putin was in the Russian city of Kazan welcoming leaders of countries which together make up nearly half the world's population.
articles.title: BRICS gathers pace as shared grievances with West fuel alliance
